abstract: A lingering labor dispute in an industrial town hardens to views of striking workers.
snippet: A lingering labor dispute in an industrial town hardens to views of striking workers.
lead_paragraph: MANESAR -- Two lanes of traffic and a barbed wire-topped fence separate the grey-striped Maruti Suzuki India plant from dozens of workers on strike outside.Security guards in blue shirts and navy slacks eye the workers, coalesced under a fuchsia-colored tent, warily through the fence. Striking workers, both inside and outside the plant, have halted production, costing Maruti and its vendors an estimated 30 billion Indian rupees (about $612 million) so far.

headline.main: Anyone Who Fights 'Will be Ground to Dust'
